title: Virtual Intersections: Isolation
hero_caption: Bronislaw M. Bak, printed by Studio Press, Chicago. Art Institute, from One-Hundred Views of Chicago, 1967. Gift of Helene M. Cox.
short_description:
The pandemic has forced all of us to face the challenges of isolation. With the onset of winter and in the midst of a difficult holiday season, we can expect those challenges to continue. In this session of Intersections, Sam Ramos, associate director of Innovation and Creativity, and nikhil trivedi, director of web engineering, bring people together to consider artworks that help us understand, relieve, and come to terms with isolation.

In this interactive series, the Art Institute’s collection and exhibitions serve as catalysts for conversations about urgent social questions and current events. Come ready to participate and create community through dialogue about art.
list_description: Reflect on urgent social questions and current events through dialogue about art.
description:
The pandemic has forced all of us to face the challenges of isolation. With the onset of winter and in the midst of a difficult holiday season, we can expect those challenges to continue. In this session of Intersections, Sam Ramos, associate director of Innovation and Creativity, and nikhil trivedi, director of web engineering, bring people together to consider artworks that help us understand, relieve, and come to terms with isolation.

In this interactive series, the Art Institute’s collection and exhibitions serve as catalysts for conversations about urgent social questions and current events. Come ready to participate and create community through dialogue about art.

We recommend using a laptop or desktop computer, and downloading the latest version of Zoom to enjoy this program.

If you have any questions about virtual programming, please reach out to museum-programs@artic.edu.

For questions related to accessibility accommodations, please email access@artic.edu.
